title: Elsa OpenClaw
shortDescription: The AI coordinator system powering the Super Agents team — built on OpenClaw.
description:
Elsa is the mission-critical orchestration layer of the Super Agents ecosystem. Built on the OpenClaw framework, she serves as the central nervous system for an autonomous workforce, transforming a collection of AI models into a cohesive, high-performance team.

1. Multi-Agent Architecture & Protocol

At her core, Elsa manages a specialized team of ephemeral sub-agents. Communication is standardized via CAP/3.1 (Canonical Agent Protocol), a model-agnostic standard designed by Elsa to handle complex task dispatching and error escalation.

  • Elsa (Coordinator): Powered by Claude 4.6/Sonnet 4.5, handles high-level decision-making and human interaction.
  • Jarvis (Technical Specialist): Optimized on Gemini Flash for DevOps, coding, and system operations.
  • Anna (Research & Content): Specialized in documentation, Notion management, and data analysis.

2. Automated Operations & Maintenance

The system is built for 'zero-touch' reliability. Elsa manages her own health through a suite of automated maintenance scripts:

  • Health Monitoring: Real-time connectivity checks for Home Assistant, Notion, and Google Workspace.
  • Daily Resilience: Automatic daily and weekly backups to a private GitHub repository (elsa-openclaw) and Google Drive.
  • Cron Orchestration: 13+ active cron jobs managing everything from Garmin health briefings to security audits.

3. Workspace Isolation & Architecture

To ensure maximum efficiency and security, the system implements Workspace Isolation. By moving project outputs out of the core OpenClaw workspace, the 'brain' remains lightweight and performant.

  • New Architecture Rule: workspace=brain, ~/Projects/=output.
  • 99.7% Size Reduction: Workspace footprint reduced from 775MB to 2.6MB by offloading static project data to ~/Projects/.
  • Automated Lifecycle: Cleanup scripts (weekly cron) now cover both the core workspace and ~/Projects/ for end-to-end maintenance.

4. Security & The Execution Firewall

Safety is non-negotiable. Elsa implements a 3-tier Execution Firewall that governs how agents interact with the host system. This ensures that while agents have the power to write code and manage databases (via Prisma/SQLite), they are strictly prohibited from destructive or unauthorized external actions.

5. Self-Evolution (Blueprint v2)

Using the Workspace Blueprint v2, Elsa maintains a self-documenting environment. She is capable of refactoring her own scripts, updating project schemas, and maintaining a clean, professional workspace. This self-improving loop ensures the system evolves alongside the user's needs.
features: CAP/3.1 model-agnostic agent protocol with DISPATCH/REPORT envelopes
Multi-agent coordination: Elsa (Coordinator), Jarvis (Tech), Anna (Content)
Workspace isolation: projects moved to ~/Projects/, reducing workspace from 775MB to 2.6MB (99.7%)
Automated cleanup script covers both workspace + ~/Projects/ (weekly cron)
New architecture rule: workspace=brain, ~/Projects/=output
3-tier Execution Firewall for safe autonomous database and shell access
Automated daily backups to private GitHub repo (elsa-openclaw) and GDrive
Workspace Blueprint v2: Organized system scripts and memory architecture
Real-world integrations: Garmin health briefings and Home Assistant control
Self-documenting and self-evolving system via iterative PR workflows
SQLite + Prisma 6.4.0 backend for persistent agent memory and state

title: Autonomous Coding Agent
shortDescription: A multi-agent system (Elsa, Jarvis, Anna) using the CAP v3.2 protocol for autonomous software engineering and research.
description: The Autonomous Coding Agent system operates with Elsa as Coordinator, Jarvis as Technical Worker, and Anna as Research/Content Worker, collaborating via the Canonical Agent Protocol (CAP) v3.2. Tasks are managed through DISPATCH, REPORT, BLOCKED, and CLARIFY envelopes, ensuring high reliability and fail-fast error handling. The system features a multi-tier Execution Firewall for safety, was used to build this very portfolio, and utilizes a routing matrix to optimize performance and costs across various AI models.
features: CAP v3.2 protocol: Model-agnostic communication using structured DISPATCH/REPORT envelopes
Routing matrix: Intelligent task allocation to optimize cost and performance (Haiku for code, Flash for scans)
Execution Firewall: Multi-tier safety layer governing autonomous database and shell access
Sequential-first spawn policy: Reliable task execution with isolated parallel paths when safe
BLOCKED handler with error taxonomy: Advanced error classification for fast recovery and escalation
Cost optimization: Targeted model routing using Claude Sonnet 4.6, Haiku 4.5, and Gemini Flash 3

title: Axon AI Model™
shortDescription: A strategic AI transformation framework embedding autonomous agents into the Axon Active Agile development cycle.
description: AxonAI redefines how offshore development teams operate by embedding AI tools—GitHub Copilot, Cursor, and Claude Code—directly into Axon Active's proprietary Scrum-based Axon Model™. The project produced the Axon AI Model™, a layered framework that reshapes developer roles into AI Pilots, Scrum Masters into AI-Enhanced Facilitators, and Product Owners into Value Engineers, with governance cycles spanning PO, EAT, and EMS levels. Research deliverables include a sales pitch for prospective clients, a 1000+ word strategic proposal for existing customers, and an internal staff guidebook featuring the 3-Prompt Rule and a Junior Gap apprenticeship solution. The enterprise governance layer addresses Private LLM policy, IP protection, and Copilot Enterprise rollout strategy across dedicated offshore teams.
features: Axon AI Model™ framework defining role shifts for all Scrum personas (Developer → AI Pilot, SM → AI-Enhanced Facilitator, PO → Value Engineer)
Agentic SDLC workflow mapping GitHub Copilot, Cursor, and Claude Code to each sprint phase
Sales pitch and 1000+ word strategic proposal documents published and synchronized to Notion
Internal staff guidebook: AI-First Onboarding, Pair Programming 2.0, and the 3-Prompt Rule
Junior Gap solution: AI-assisted apprenticeship model bridging skill gaps for junior developers
Enterprise governance layer: Private LLM policy, IP protection standards, and Copilot Enterprise adoption guidance

title: DevDay 2026
shortDescription: Event planning and content management system for Da Nang's largest annual tech conference, themed 'AI x Human: The Future of Co-Intelligence.'
description: DevDay Da Nang 2026 is Vietnam's premier non-profit IT festival, gathering over 3,000 tech enthusiasts to explore the 'AI x Human' paradigm. Hosted at Duy Tan University, the event features 40+ global speakers across specialized tracks, showcasing the future of co-intelligence, automation workflows, and AI-driven innovation.
features: Theme: AI x Human: Redefining collaboration in the age of intelligence.
Attendance: 3,000+ developers, entrepreneurs, and students.
Tracks: 6 specialized AI tracks including Autonomous Agents and AI Ethics.
Networking: Exclusive VIP lounge and industry-leading career fair.
Community: Largest non-profit tech gathering in Central Vietnam.
